intro: Cardenasia, commonly known as the "Carnation of the Andes," is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and evergreen, and it produces small, elliptical fruits that contain seeds. Cardenasia is valued both for its ornamental beauty and its ecological role in its native habitat.
